conbody.p: Eucalyptus includes optional, subscription only support for integrating enterprise-grade SAN (Storage Area Network) hardware devices into a Eucalyptus cloud. SAN support extends the functionality of the Eucalyptus Storage Controller (SC) to provide a high performance data conduit between VMs running in Eucalyptus and attached SAN devices. Eucalyptus dynamically manages SAN storage without the need for the administrator to manually allocate and de-allocate storage, manage snapshots or set up data connections.

image.alt: High-level architecture of Eucalyptus with SAN Support Extended functionality of the Eucalyptus Storage Controller (SC) allows for integration of enterprise-grade SAN devices into a Eucalyptus cloud. VMs running in Eucalyptus link directly to attached SANs, thus avoiding I/O communication bottlenecks of the physical host.

conbody.p: Eucalyptus with SAN support allows you to:

ul.li: Integrate Eucalyptus block storage functionality (dynamic block volumes, snapshots, creating volumes from snapshots, etc.) with existing SAN devices
Link VMs in the Eucalyptus cloud directly to SAN devices, thereby removing I/O communication bottlenecks of the physical hardware host
Incorporate enterprise-level SAN features (high-speed, large-capacity, reliability) to deliver a production-ready EBS (block storage) solution for the enterprise
Attach SAN devices to Eucalyptus deployments on Xen, KVM, and VMware hypervisors

conbody.p: To use Eucalyptus with supported SAN storage, you must decide whether administrative access can be provided to Eucalyptus to control the SAN. If this is possible in your environment, Eucalyptus can automatically and dynamically manage SAN storage.

Currently, the Dell Equallogic series of SANs (PS 4000 and PS 6000) and NetApp Filer FAS 2000 and FAS 6000 series are supported. For Dell Equallogic, Eucalyptus requires SSH access to enable automatic provisioning. Eucalyptus will manage NetApp SANs via ONTAPI (version 7.3.3 and above).
